intro: Calceolaria quindioensis, commonly known as the Quindío slipper orchid, is a species native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is known for its delicate, hairy leaves. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
